meanings.definition: The act of making someone fit or capable of a particular task or role.
meanings.sent1: The habilitation of the new employee involved training and mentoring.
meanings.sent2: She underwent habilitation to prepare for her new job.
meanings.sent3: The habilitation of the penguin to become a waiter was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to habilitation turned him into a skilled craftsman.
meanings.sent5: The habilitation program transformed him into a confident leader.

meanings.definition: The process of acquiring a skill or ability.
meanings.sent1: The habilitation of language skills takes time and practice.
meanings.sent2: Children go through habilitation to learn how to ride a bike.
meanings.sent3: The cat's habilitation in meowing was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her habilitation in painting was like watching a flower bloom.
meanings.sent5: The habilitation of his memory made him a trivia champion.
